intro: Ellipanthus curtisii, commonly known as the Curtis's ellipanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sedges. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
